conclusion: Assume the process from state B to C is isobaric due to lack of specific information.
State B: P_B = 2 x 10^5 Pa, V_B = 2 x 10^-3 m^3; State C: P_C = 2 x 10^5 Pa, V_C = 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
Work done in an isobaric process is calculated using W = P ΔV.
Calculate ΔV: ΔV = V_C - V_B = 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate work done: W = 2 x 10^5 Pa x 1 x 10^-3 m^3 = 200 J.
The work done by the gas from state B to state C is 200 J.
